title: Alex James Widdicombe Traffic Incident Report (Greenville County Sheriff's Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all service and incident-level data relating to a traffic incident in which a pedestrian, Alex James Widdicombe, was struck by a vehicle in the city of Greenville on or about the night of March 2nd, 2019.

In order to help to determine my status for purposes of determining the applicability of any fees, you should know that I am the brother of the above mentioned pedestrian, Alex James Widdicombe, and am seeking this information purely for my own clarity regarding ongoing concerns over his mental health. To be clear, I am seeking this information for personal use and not for a commercial use.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Widdicombe

title: Deputy Chief AHCA/DMS (Agency for Healthcare Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All written communications from or to Katie Strickland from the following individuals:
Jason Weida, 
Stefan Grow
Pedro Allende, or
John Schrader
 between 1/1/2021 and the present, which are in reference to the hiring of Sketch Piers in his current capacity at the Agency for Health Care Administration.

All documents relevant to the hiring of Sketch Piers in his current capacity, including the qualifications of any other candidates considered, as well as any record of Piers' previous job performance, and previous salary rates, during his tenure with the State of Florida.

All allegations of misconduct, determinations of misconduct, investigations, communications or inquiries, either resolved or pending (to the extent they are public record pursuant to FL. Stat. Ch. 119) which reference Katie Strickland and have been directed to the above listed individuals in either an official capacity or to the respective agencies under their purview.

The travel requests, approvals, calendars, and all documents pertaining to official state travel including food and lodging expenses of both Katie Strickland and Sketch Piers from the dates 1/1/2021 to the present, including prospective travel that has not occurred but has generated responsive documents as of the date of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Lauren Grummond

title: Request for ZEEVIC Work Group Meeting Records

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for ZEEVIC Work Group Meeting Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking access to records related to the Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council (ZEEVIC) Work Group meetings held since July 1, 2023. These records include agendas, lists of attendees, and meeting notes as well as any other related records. I am interested in records from both the ZEV Policy Scorecard Work Group and the Trucking MHDV Infrastructure Work Group meetings, as well as any other ZEEVIC Work Group meetings that have been held. I am also seeking any records announcing the Work Group meetings as well as any communications inviting attendees or potential attendees. 

If all or any part of this request is denied, I request that I be provided with a written explanation that includes the reason for the denial, the legal authority justifying the denial, and my appeal rights. If you determine that some portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, please provide me with the portions that can be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lanny Hartmann
